data.text: @SueJonesSays @odwyer_john61 @ProfColinDavis @BorisJohnson It's hard isn't it. I'm CEV too and we haven't had any visitors in 2 years now. My respiratory consultant says I'm still as high risk so what can we do? It's a hard choice to make.
@Peradventur3 @ProfColinDavis It appears the English government has decided testing is not necessary as Johnson has "abolished" covid.
@rosalynemf @ProfColinDavis How does that affect the testing availability for orders in England?
@Peradventur3 @ProfColinDavis We've had no problem getting tests at the local pharmacy in Glasgow.
@MadoE007 @ProfColinDavis Because the mask has so effectively eradicated covid… oops…
@rosalynemf @ProfColinDavis Schools are no longer testing, and LFTs can only be ordered every 3 days. And a lot of people seem to think it's 'over'. Those people are part of the reason it's not.

@juliettesmith99 @thinkofthehuma1 @ProfColinDavis Deaths rose though, which is the more important point.

Over 12000 between July and October compared to 4000 in the same period in 2020.

@NotRight510710 @thinkofthehuma1 @ProfColinDavis I've already explained why deaths (and not cases) increased in July and onwards - vaccine immunity was waning in the elderly. Zilch to do with restrictions being eased.
